title: How to Make Marzipan

steps.headline: Sift the powdered sugar into a bowl on top of the ground almonds.
Add remaining ingredients.
steps.description: Mix to make a stiff paste. You can use a little water mixed with brandy instead of the egg whites if you do not want to eat raw eggs.

steps.headline: Cook sugar and water on low heat.
steps.description: Constantly stir until the sugar has dissolved.

steps.headline: Add cream of tartar and bring the mixture to boil.
steps.description: The sugar should reach about 240˚F (116˚C). This is called the soft ball stage.

steps.headline: Remove the mixture from heat.
steps.description: Mix until it turns cloudy. Add ground almonds and vanilla extract.

steps.headline: Lightly whisk the egg white.
steps.description: Add it to the pan and put the mixture back on low heat. Stir for a couple of minutes.

steps.headline: Dust the confectioners' sugar on a marble (or similar) surface.
steps.description: Pour the mixture over it. Work the two with a palate knife. Tip: If the mixture is too sticky, add a little more confectioners' sugar.

steps.headline: Cover mixture with plastic wrap and cool.
steps.description: Knead it until smooth once it has cooled down.

tyn: flat surface to knead the marzipan (e.g. marble slab, baking sheet)
